title: A bit of PCKF history
content:
I 'discovered' today that the Internet Archive has a lot more [url=http://web.archive.org/web/*/http://pub7.ezboard.com/bpubliccommanderkeenforum]archived PCKF[/url] than previously thought.

There's actually a suprising number of threads which have been preserved in the archive at various points from 2001 up to 2004.

I was going to save all the pages, clean them up and upload them somewhere else for refrence, but the Archive has archived a lot of threads from various points during the forum's exsistence, making an accurate archive of the board slightly difficult.

But not impossible.

I was talking with Spleen today and he suggested that anyone interested join in and work together to collect all the pages and build multiple archives of the board, from different points in time.

I personally think collecting all the pages from the Archive and storing them somewhere more accessible could be a good idea.

But if not, go take a look at your history. Some links in the archives will take you to the present board for some reason and some links won't have any page to load at all, but there's quite a few archived pages there.--------------
[url=http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/][img]http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/imgs/links/pccwsml.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: A bit of PCKF history
content:
The reason that the links take you to the present board is that the threads have not been archived, so the Wayback Machine fetches the latest page from the original website - this is why there are a lot of "topic not found" errors. I saved the Harry Potter thread in its entirety before the attack for some reason, so I can add that to the "pile" if you want.

Actually, what you've found is rather interesting: I had no idea you could access this board via pub7. (I only knew of b7, pub128 and p072, which has the least posts of all)

EDIT: Upon inspection, almost none of the threads and few of the forum pages are actually intact. Additionally, pub7 redirects to p072 - so it isn't actually anything new.[url=http://last.fm/users/grafix5000/][img]http://toxicsheep.com/sigs/scrobbler.png[/img][/url]
[url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url]

title: Re: A bit of PCKF history
content: I have archives from the old CC314 UBB, and the Keen forum at the JMMB. I haven't published these, though.

title: Hmm, I have thought about it and,
content: We should have a historical topic archive were we keep important topics that contain future history.

title: Re: Hmm, I have thought about it and,
Re: Hmm, I have thought about it and,
content:
Future's history would be the current time. I can't see a reason why we should archive the current topics yet.
Besides, there hasn't been anything really important or interesting lately.Eat your veggies!

title: Re: Hmm, I have thought about it and,
content:
Yeah, there's lots of borken links in the archived versions, although I noticed when I was browsing them yesterday, some links do work the first time, then when clicked again, go to a different version of the archived page, or say there's nothing archived there at all...

I should have also mentioned that there's some forums on the board which barely have anything archived at all, as grafix said before, but this '[url=http://web.archive.org/web/20020105060659/pub7.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumtheclassics]Classics[/url]' archive (that is, that specific page - not page 2 and 3), for example, has a a lot of threads saved. They're not the most memorable threads, but most of them do work.--------------
[url=http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/][img]http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/imgs/links/pccwsml.gif[/img][/url]
